Metra Alert  - The Millennium Station elevator temporarily out of service

The Millennium Station elevator is temporarily out of service. Recommended alternative accessible locations are Van Buren Street and South Water Street Entrance. Metra will provide updated information once service has been restored.
http://metrarail.com/metra/en/home.html?Twitter=1&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Category=Elevator
Metra Alert  - The Homewood east elevator not accessible; station under construction

The Homewood East elevator is temporarily not accessible due to construction on the east side of the station. Recommended alternative accessible locations are Calumet and Flossmoor. Metra will provide  updated information once service has been restored.
http://metrarail.com/metra/en/home.html?Twitter=1&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Category=Elevator
Metra Alert  - The Kenosha elevator temporarily out of service
The Kenosha elevator is temporarily out of service. Recommended alternative accessible location is Winthrop Harbor. Metra will provide  updated information once service has been restored.
http://metrarail.com/metra/en/home.html?Twitter=1&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Category=Elevator
Metra Alert  - The Homewood Platform elevator temporarily out of service

The Homewood Platform elevator is temporarily out of service. Recommended alternative accessible locations are Flossmoor and Calumet. Metra will provide  updated information once service has been restored.
http://metrarail.com/metra/en/home.html?Twitter=1&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1
Metra Alert  - Inbound trains to Chicago will board from the temporary platform north of Lawrence at Ravenswood.
Attention Ravenswood Customers, inbound trains to Chicago will board from the temporary platform north of Lawrence.

Train 2239 delayed
Train #2239 is operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule due to Freight Train Interference.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/UP-W?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=1&gtfsrt=1
UPW #62, Delayed 20-25 Mins.

Inbound train #62, scheduled to arrive Chicago at 7:12 PM may be operating 20 to 25 minutes behind schedule due to freight train interference. Please listen to platform announcements for the location of your train.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert ME - Homewood East Side Construction Will Begin March 13

Beginning Monday, March 13, access to the Homewood Station from the east will be closed for station construction until Summer 2024.  Access to the boarding platform will be through the Park Avenue entrance ONLY (west side of tracks).

 

Beginning, Monday, March 6, the Pace bus stop will relocate from Harwood Avenue to Park Avenue.  Please allow additional time and use caution near the work zone.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Brainerd Platform Rehabilitation Will Begin Monday, April 24

Beginning Monday, April 24, the west half of Platform #2 will be closed for rehabilitation.  Customers must use the pedestrian crossing at Loomis Street to access the boarding platforms.  The work will move to the east half of platform #2 and into Platform #1 to complete the project by the end of July.  Please allow additional time to access the in-service portion of the platform.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert RI - Construction begins April 21 at 103rd Street Washington Heights Station.
Metra forces will begin work Friday, April 21 on a major rehab project at the 103rd Street/Washington Heights Station on the Rock Island Line, for more informaiton click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert HC - Chicago Union Station Service Disruption April 26th

Dear Customers,

Please accept our apologies for the service disruptions and congestion you experienced last night at Chicago Union Station. Every rush period at Union Station relies on the smooth operation of a series of switches that allow for trains to use multiple routes to and from the platforms. Those switches are maintained by Amtrak, the owner of Chicago Union Station and the tracks and switches that approach the facility. Last night, a switch between the platforms and the yard used by BNSF and SWS trains failed. As a result, there were fewer routes available for trains to enter and exit the station, creating congestion and delays until the switch was repaired. Metra and Amtrak are meeting to look for ways to prevent a recurrence and to better handle similar situations. We thank each and every one of you for your support and understanding.

Metra
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
